sen.j: 海量（かいりょう、1733年 - 1817年）は、江戸時代後期の浄土真宗の僧、教育者、歌人。
sen.e: Kairyo (1733-1817) was a priest of Jodo Shinshu sect (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism), educator and Kajin (waka poet), who lived in the later Edo period.
Kairyo (1733-1817) was a priest of Jodo Shin sect (the True Pure Land Sect of Buddhism), an educator and a Kajin (waka poet), who lived in the later Edo period.

sen.j: 近江国犬上郡の浄土真宗の寺に生まれる。
sen.e: Kairyo was born in a temple of the Jodo Shinshu sect at Inukami-gun County (also called Inugami no kori, Inugamikori, Inugamigori or Inukamigori), Omi Province.

sen.e: Kairyo was born at a temple of Jodo Shin sect in Inukami-gun County (also called Inugami no kori, Inugamikori, Inugamigori or Inukamigori), Omi Province.

sen.j: 近江国彦根藩主井伊直中に招かれ、1799年（寛政11年）藩校である弘道館を開き、藩学の振興に力を尽くした。
sen.e: Invited by Naonaka Ii who was the Lord of Hikone Domain in Omi Province, Kairyo founded the Kodokan school which was a han-ko school (school of a feudal domain) in 1799, thereby endeavoring in promotion of hangaku (schooling for samurai children).

sen.j: 賀茂真淵に師事し、国学・歌学にも通じた。
sen.e: Being a disciple of KAMO no Mabuchi himself, Kairyo was familiar with Kokugaku (the study of Japanese classical literature) and Kagaku (the study of Japanese poetry; poetics).

sen.e: He left a collection of poems: "Hitoyohana" (literally, night blooming flowers or flowers which bloom on an overnight basis).
